_comment: Created by ianb on 01/10/2014 11:57:20 using v2.1
title: How has the number of nurses, midwvies, and health visitors changed?
analysis_commentary: There is annual variation in the number of nurses, midwives, and health visitors, with a trough each August followed by a rise as newly qualified staff members join the workforce. A peak in numbers is then reached in the winter, followed by a decline as staff leave the workforce. There was a decrease in the average number of staff members between 2009 and 2012, but since then the numbers have increased.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, NHS Hospital & Community Health Service Workforce Statistics
